Type.Name: Box

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Box extends Gtk.Container implements class GLib.IWrapper, class Gtk.IOrientable

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: A Box is a Gtk container that holds an arbitrary number of widgets. This means its sole purpose is to provide layout, size and spacing for other widgets.

remarks.para: A Box is a rectangular area organized into either a single row or a single column of child widgets, depending upon whether the box is horizontally or vertically oriented, respectively.
A Box is abstract - specific layout containers are provided in its sub classes, including a horizontal box, (), a vertical box (), and button boxes, ().

Widgets that are 'packed' into a box are considered to be the children of the box, and the box controls their layout. Properties such as control the layout of all the children in the box, whereas specific packing settings can be applied to each child individually, such as .

Docs.param: A widget to pack into the box.
If , the child widget will expand to use as much space as it is given.
If , the child widget will request as much space as is available.
The size (in pixels) of a border to place around the specified child widget.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ReorderChild (Gtk.Widget child, int position);
.method public hidebysig instance void ReorderChild(class Gtk.Widget child, int32 position) cil managed

Docs.param: A widget that has already been packed into this box.

param.name: position
param.para: The new position for this widget, indexed from zero. If negative, the will be placed at the end of the box.

Docs.summary: Alters the position of a child widget that has already been packed into a Box.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetChildPacking (Gtk.Widget child, bool expand, bool fill, uint padding, Gtk.PackType pack_type);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetChildPacking(class Gtk.Widget child, bool expand, bool fill, unsigned int32 padding, valuetype Gtk.PackType pack_type) cil managed

Docs.param: The child widget whose layout should be adjusted
If , the child widget will expand to use as much space as it is given.
If , the child widget will request as much space as is available.
The size (in pixels) of a border to place around the specified child widget.
Whether this child widget should be packed from the beginning of the box, (eg. the left, or the top), or from the end, (eg. the right or the bottom)
Docs.summary: Change the packing properties of a child that is currently in this box.

remarks.para: It is more common to set any specific packing requirements on child widgets when they are initially added to the box. This can be done using and .
